description:
“A dark pretentious strategy card game for people who love kids and monsters, just the same.”

Monsters and Kids is a 2-4 player card game for everyone who loves the bizarre, weird, darkness and more bizarre. (Because you can never have enough of bizarre.)

If you are not afraid of monsters, U.F.O.s or anything supernatural, the kids could really use your help. Save them from disasters and look out for enemies while constantly making sure you have enough cards to survive another turn.

So, in conclusion, Monsters and Kids is a turn by turn strategic card game created by two architects. The strategies range from developing cute illustrations, attractive intro videos, nursery rhymes, dark themes, self-referential humor to deadly aggressive attacks for pulling in maximum people.

—description from the designer

CardsLab Countries is an award winning game from Novabase Gameshifters 2016 gamification event held at Portugal. The game was launched at November 2017, after intensive testing with different kinds of audiences and revisions.

The pack consists of a deck with 75 cards (60 of countries with contents and stats, 12 special cards, a card with 60 country flags, 2 cards with shortened game rules), a rulebook and a world map. Each country card has the flag, location and capital, as well as stats like population, life expectancy or gdp. The game mechanics is "turn-based" and the goal is to get all the opponents' cards, which are initially distributed to everyone, forming a stack for each player (upside down).

Each turn consists of 4 phases. In the first phase, each player places 5 cards in his hand and can play special cards that change the course of the game, such as stealing the opponent's turn, double the winning prize, exchange all hand cards between 2 players or cancel any of these effects. In the next phase, the turn owner chooses a card from his hand, puts it upside down on the table and will have to decide between asking a question about the card to an opponent of his choice (flag/location/capital) or choose a statistic that will have to beat all opponents cards. For the latter, after the turn owner announces the statistic he chose, each opponent will have to pick a card from his hand and put it upside down on the table, to win the duel. This adds suspense, bluff and fun on each turn, forcing the player to carefully choose his plays. At the end of the turn, the winner receives as prize x cards from the opponents hands, depending on the special cards played, the duel type (question or statistic battle) and player count.

Many educational/general knowledge board games lack the fun and socialization offered by CardsLab. It's an 8-80 trivia & strategy game designed with a simple mechanics that can easily put 3 different generations playing at the same table. Also, without noticing, we are learning much faster than by reading a book.

CardsLab - Improving Knowledge Through Gamification.

—description from the publisher

Be the best God of Judgment.
Get points four ways: Use your power to bid for followers or to activate them as heralds. At the end of the game, get points for fairness and for hidden goals.

—description from the publisher

Young Diplodocuses (Diplos) are fond of the tasty leaves offered by the neighboring pastures. To win, your Diplo team has to eat more leaves than your opponent's team…unless one of you decides to call the ferocious T. Rex to get rid of all his opponent's Diplos!

To set up Jurassic Snack, create a square at random with the four playing boards, place four Diplos of your color on the matching egg spaces, then shuffle the grass tokens and place them face down on the 28 empty spaces. Two actions are available on a turn: moving a Diplo of your color or moving a T. Rex. The players take turns performing two actions each, which can be the same or different, and which can involve the same Dino or T. Rex, or not.

A Diplo has one single goal: eating grass tokens. It moves in a straight line until it's blocked by another Diplo, a T. Rex, the edge of the playing area, or a grass token. In this last case, the Diplo takes the grass token to eat it and immediately applies one of the six effects: birth, T. Rex appearance, Diplo move, etc.

The T. Rex has one single goal: scaring the Diplos away. The movement rules for the T. Rex are the same as for the Diplos'. When it meets a Diplo, the T. Rex is placed on the Diplo's space, and the Diplo is placed back into its owner's pool.

The game ends when no grass tokens remain in the playing area. The player who has eaten the most grass wins. A game can also end when a player has no Diplo of their color in the playing area.

Newsroom is a worker placement game where you get to manage your own international media outlet. The aim of the game is to publish your newspaper editions earlier than other players thus gaining the trust of your audience and of the advertisers and boosting your global presence as an International media outlet.

In the beginning of the round, news come out in different countries around the world in different fields (politics, economy, sports, culture). Each story is associated to countries with the roll of dice. Players have in their disposal a Press team and send its members to cover some of the stories, by interviewing people and getting their news copy back in the paper. 
 Each edition is divided in 4 blocks (newspaper columns) and has to cover at least 10 content points which derive from the news pieces that journalists bring back or, later in the game, from advertisements. Once the edition content is complete, the paper goes to the editors while journalists are free to get some more news stories from around the world.

After the editors have checked your story, the copy moves on to printing and is published. Its time to collect money, to pay your Press team and to hire better journalists, or more editors or printers to get your next edition even faster. Remember, the competition in the media is fierce and if you lose time the other media outlets will get your story out and it will then be worth nothing to you or your audience.

Based in the queuing theory, Newsroom is an easy to learn but hard to master worker placement- economic management game where speed and effectiveness determine the winner. Much like in the real media world!

—description from the designer

Ascension: Year Four Collector's Edition includes Ascension: Realms Unraveled and Ascension: Dawn of Champions, as well as all two copies of the promo cards from that year. The set also includes 100% foil cards, foil game board, portable storage box, dividers, and an Honor token bag!

Battle as one of the game's marquee characters with Champion cards and use the game's first multi-faction cards to Rally and Multi-Unite for explosive turns! All 363 cards, and the over-sized Champion cards, are made with a premium foil finish.

This boxed set is playable as a standalone 1-4 player game and is completely compatible with other Ascension expansions!

It’s the classic Monopoly game taken to a galaxy far, far away!

Relive the original Star Wars story and make a fortune as you...
Shape your destiny with the Force and Smuggler’s Cargo cards!
Collect classic scenes and iconic ship from 1977 movie!
Build Fleets and Bases, and side with the Rebels or the Empire!

—description from the publisher

All things being equal the next election could go either way. It's up to you to make sure it swings in your party's favor. Campaign to encourage your voters and discourage your opponent's, change voter trends, and manipulate political boundaries to make sure your party gets into office. Players rearrange, flip, and replace tiles while manipulating the borders that make up the districts in game about American politics.

—description from the publisher

Lost Atlantis is described by the publisher as a "3X game under the sea".

Lost Atlantis is now an underwater exploration game where players gather clues to discover sunken pyramids, defeat their guardians, and collect treasures. The core of the game is a puzzle revealed by compass directions found by players on seafloor tiles. Players use these directions to scour the quadrants of the board for clues to discover pyramids. There is a central portal in the middle of the board that accumulates player scoring tokens as pyramids are claimed, and the game ends when all the central portal spaces are filled up. The player who accumulates the most Victory points throughout the game wins.

The overpopulated Earth is slowly dying. Three human Factions: The Confederation of Sol, the Outer-Worlds Alliance and the Praetorans of Mars have been fighting for domination of the solar system with space fleets from their bases orbiting Earth, Mars and Titan.

Now with the perfection of the FTL hyper drive, Scout-ships are finally able to explore distant stars. Earth, Mars and Titan have agreed a truce in order to settle colonists in new star systems far from our star.

With a small fleet of ships, you must seek out and settling habitable worlds, but you would be wise to hire warships from these factions to protect your Outposts, for the future of these colonies will be beyond the control of Earth.

Send out your Scouts to explore new systems, send out your Transports to bring back rare minerals and gasses to finance your fleet. Hire warships from the Confederation, Alliance and Praetoran navies for your private fleet.

Build Outpost ships and finally Colony ships to settle worlds and claim the title of Star Lord!

In the game you will upgrade your starting deck of Scout ships and Basic Transports with a fleet of warship cards from the three space faring factions. You can buy Outpost ships to build Outposts and later upgrade these to Colonies on suitable worlds you have explored or else capture them from other players. You may control 4 systems at any time by deploying your ships there.

Objective: Control 4 Victory stars. Each Outpost is 1 star, Each Colony (upgrading Outpost) worth 2 stars. This means you win immediately when you control a Colony on 2 worlds, or an Outpost on 4 worlds.

The main USPs for Star Colonies are:  

     Area control (of star systems). Deploying ships to defend or to trade: carrying over unused credits, but you take a risk: extra Credits or nothing if system is seized.  
     Flip discard to draw deck (not shuffle!) so build order stays intact. In the advanced game we add Infiltrators as deck manipulators.  
     Interaction: ability to intercept an attack (with cards from hand) or to target specific star systems and deployed enemy ships.  


The full game works just as well with 2, 3 or 4 players. Players can start with a more peaceful tutor-mode game before the full on strategy game with the full card set.

—description from the designer

The Lemmings were getting too comfortable where they lived.
There were too many Lemmings because they have been eating too much.
Now, there was no food left so the Lemmings decided to leave and try and find a new place to live.

Timing is important especially when starting out on a journey. When one Lemming starts out other Lemmings will follow, because they have the same instincts. The object of the game is to be the first to send out all your Lemmings.

—description from the publisher

In Little Town, you lead a team of architects and must dispatch workers to the town, collect resources and money, build buildings, and develop this little town.

In the game, which lasts four rounds, you can acquire resources such as wood, stones, fish, and wheat from the surrounding squares by putting workers on the board, with three workers being placed each round. When you place a worker, you acquire the resources available in all eight surrounding spaces. You can build buildings by using these resources, and you — or any other player — can gain the effect of the building when place a worker next to it; if you place next to a building owned by another, however, you must pay them a coin before you can collect those resources.

Players collect victory points by using the powers of buildings, by constructing buildings, and by achieving goals dealt to them at the beginning of the game. After four rounds, whoever has the most victory points wins.

—description from the publisher

With a unique cast of characters with special powers from the Eisner Award-nominated comic series, you and up to seven friends play as a gang of shifty shady felines trying to keep their speakeasy afloat.

The game is cooperative with all players loading into their car, the Fordor, and exploring a randomly arranged deck of location cards laid out face down on the table. Players must get enough of "The Good Stuff" back to the Lackadaisy Speakeasy before the time runs out and the speakeasy folds like a cheap suit. Players will need to arm themselves and use the special location powers to their best ability to win. With event cards that can help as much as harm, the tide of the game can turn at any moment.

Play your cards to build a shared network of roads, rails, rivers, and trails. Block your opponents while scoring paths for yourself -- but don't forget about any of your own paths, or you'll be caught short at the end!

The war had raged for millennia. Or it started just a week ago, depending on how you look at it. Time travel can be quite confusing. What's known for certain is that the fighting is between four different sides: The Aliens, the Apes and Monkeys, the Robots, and the Space Vikings. They all got access to the temporal technologies at the same time, not that "same time" means much in this situation. With time travel it doesn't really matter *when* it's invented...

Each player is sending out their agents to different points in the timestream, trying to control key time periods and technologies. By planning your moves right you can re-use the same cards multiple times, and even revive agents killed in action!

Time War(p) is a quick card game for two to four players ages 13 and up.

—description from the publisher

Summon the Great Old Ones by having them align their bodies over Arkham.

In the game A'Writhe: A Game of Eldritch Contortions, players gather in teams of two. Each team consists of a cultist player and a Great Old One player. The cultist is assisting the Great Old One and attempting to summon them to our plane. To do this, the cultist instructs their deity, with great veneration, to place an appendage on top of an Arkham landmark to complete a specific pattern. The problem is that it is nigh impossible to have one Great Old One form this pattern by itself; that's why if another deity is touching any parts of your pattern, you can use that appendage to complete your own pattern!

Up to three teams of two can play in this contortionist battle of positioning.

—description from the publisher

Travel around the most beautiful places in XVIth century Europe with Montaigne!
In 1580 and 1581, Michel de Montaigne is travelling Europe on horseback. In a Travel journal, he writes of this extraordinary experience.
Become travelers and follow his steps around France, Germany, Switzerland or Italy, to discover countries through Montaigne’s eyes, meet people he encountered and think with his mind… Until King Henri III calls you back to Bordeaux, as he did with Montaigne asking him to become the city’s mayor, then you will have to end your journey and go back to the South West of France as fast as you can.

This is a multi-purpose card game for 2 to 4 players from 8 years old.
The players manage their best hand cards they will pose in front of them, deploying the many discoveries of their trip (gastronomy, meetings, visits or reading the Montaigne books ...), while observing the choices of other players.
Voyages avec Montaigne offers many mechanics interlaced in a simple and fluid way. Opportunism, interaction and anticipation make the pleasure of a game that suddenly makes one of the greatest French writers of all time very close.

In the game Voyages avec Montaigne, players place cards face up next to the last card they placed, on a line from left to right. This line represents their journey.

On their turn, players take turns with 1 action among 3 : 

     Travel : place a card from a different city AND pay the cost of the travel (0, 1 or 2 cards discarded)
     Stay : placing a card of the same city AND pick 1 new card
     Get supplies : not placing a card AND pick  and 2 new cards


Players can discard a figure met during his journey to take another action OR take a card from the discard pile.

2 travelling rules must be respected :

     At the end of their journey, players must return to Bordeaux and have placed at least on « Citation » card form each of the 3 books of Montaigne
     Players cannot go back to a city they have already been.


During their journey, players take one of the Bonus tile available as soon as they reach the objective first or do better than a player who had already achieved the objective (5 discovery bonus, 4 book bonus).

When the « King’s call » special card is revealed, all players must go back to Bordeaux as soon as possible, rules are thus modified :

     Action « Stay » is not allowed anymore
     Players cannot travel to a city that would take them further away from Bordeaux.


First players returning to Bordeaux get bonus, As soon as all players but one have returned to Bordeaux, the last player only has one turn left to play.

Bonus tiles are awarded to players : most cities visited, the most different theme cards, the most different characters encountered, largest stay.

The player with the highest score wins.

You built and defended your kingdom, and now that winter is here, you need to battle the harsh elements and chillingly scary monsters.

Dwar7s Winter is a hand-building, resource management game with tower defense elements in the gameplay. Each player wants to achieve more victory points, but the only way to survive the winter is to work together.

While Dwar7s Winter is a sequel to Dwar7s Fall, it is an independent, standalone game that includes 64 highly-detailed miniatures.

You are invited to a Killer Dinner! However, this is no ordinary dinner party. Everyone is masked and has their own hidden agenda. Who is your friend, and who is planning on stabbing you tonight?
Ask questions, collect items, and attack other partygoers to accomplish your hidden agenda before anyone else. Blend in while figuring out your fellow partygoers’ hidden agendas before it’s too late!

At the beginning of the game each player gets a card with their secret role and hidden agenda. Attending the party are The Host, The BFF, The Trickster, and The Hitman. Everyone, except the Hitman, is also informed of the Host’s profession on their Role Card. 
The Host’s agenda is to figure out who the Hitman is and to kill them. 
The BFF’s agenda is to help and protect the Host. 
The Trickster’s agenda is to attack or get attacked a total of seven times. 
The Hitman’s agenda is to figure out the Host’s profession, or to kill them.
While in the same room, players may ask each other yes/no questions to discern information about the Host’s profession, revealing who the Hitman is based on incorrect answers. Players explore the house and collect items upon entering an empty room. Items can be used to help gather information, attack other players, or replenish lost Health.
Whoever accomplishes their hidden agenda first, wins the game.

Killer Dinner is a party game that will create a new social dynamic each time it’s played. A great number of Host’s professions and the random role allocation, makes every game different. Due to the social aspect and asking questions the game is a good opportunity to get to know your fellows players better!

—description from the designers

Dry Bones Adventurer
-The Card Game-

The dusk is falling slowly as you are visiting the last nomadic town and its ruins. Amongst the old sands of the Thar desert’s heart, your guides mount the deras - tents of a small, improvised camp. Under the starry night, around the fire, sipping a chai and recovering strength accompanied by the rhythm of Nangara, you listen to the ancestral song from tribal traditions with which the old stories begin. It is in that moment when you hear this story:

"An old legend says that in the time of the Chaldeans..."

Is a card based game where you play as a traveler in the desert, trying to solve the mistery of the Yejez.Qe'l and the dry bones to revive them.

You will have to deal with storms, collect items, turn seals,
open portals, complete misions and many more.

Beat Death! Conjure!
Conjure the Spirit of the four winds!

GAMES OF LIFE

—description from the designer

The throne has remained vacant for far too long, demons assault the city, and the people have become desperate. You have travelled far to arrive in the city of Bloodstone. The desperate situation in the city has forced the Council to reach out to the powerful Demigods in hopes of finding a new ruler. You have five days to gain the favour of the council and the people. They are eager to be impressed.
    Your paths to victory are numerous: complete quests to gain favor and influence; slay the demons that spawn each night and harvest them for the riches that lay within; amass great wealth and purchase symbols of status to impress the masses. 
        You are not the only hero to see this as their opportunity. Others have journeyed to the city and will fight to impede your progress at every turn. Can you win the favour of the Council and become the next Ruler?

Demons and Demigods is a deep strategy game with immense replayability. In fact, no two games will ever be the same.

Players can all play with the same faction abilities by playing as "Civilians", or each player can choose to play as a Demigod - a unique faction with special abilities and Rages. Play as a Warlock, Earth Elemental, Giant, or one of the other unique Demigods.

Throughout 5 days, players will track their time using a unique and intuitive time track. This track consists of 24 spaces. Each player begins with 12 time before the Midnight Oil ends their day, but through upgrades it is possible to improve Ambition and start the day with more time. Each movement through the city and actions at a building costs time, so plan your route and day wisely. Whoever has the most time remaining in the day will always play next - so player order is dynamic. Once you enter the Midnight Oil your day will end.

Players move their characters throughout the game board using a one-of-a-kind worker placement mechanic. Your character blocks building action spaces. When you move, the building action space becomes available. Each game includes 9 randomly placed buildings. Depending on your strategy and immediate needs you may want to visit the Butcher to gain Bloodstones, or the Blacksmith to buy gear. You may wish to travel to the Market to make some important trades, or maybe you need to visit the Grand Palace to improve your influence. During all of this, your character is also tasked with slaying the demons that lurk at buildings and playing quests. Slaying demons and playing quests allow a character to gain influence at a building. This is tracked through a dynamic area control mechanic which makes use of a character's energy. Quests are also assigned to 1 of the 5 council members. Each member has specific themes attached to the quest, and at the end of the game, you are rewarded for having a variety of council members showing. This means you must diversify your strategies in order to impress the entire council.

Each day players will try to improve their engine to maximize the income at Day's End. They do this by unlocking dormant cubes and visiting the Philosopher's Study for upgrades. Spend the Bloodstones you have collected from slaying demons to upgrade your character. Some upgrade examples are: Income (silver, gold, energy regeneration, etc.), and Ambition (more time).

Your character starts with 18 energy cubes. These cubes are incredibly dynamic and will be used for combat with demons, upgrading abilities, area control influence, and more. How you manage your energy will greatly affect your chances of success.

At the end of the game players will score points based on their demon slays, influence, council support, and resources.

Can you be the next Ruler of Bloodstone?

“You are not breach mages yet,” Brama lectures as she paces down the line of students, her frail form belying her immense power. “Breach mages have protected us since the beginning — since the burning of the world and our pilgrimage into the dark. It was they who founded Gravehold, our last bastion, and if you wish to stand beside these living legends, you must listen and learn. The Nameless shall come again, as they always have, and you will need to be ready. You are the hope of our future.”

As a young apprentice, you grew up to stories of the breach mages. Brama, the teacher, wisest of the mages. Dezmodia, the prodigy, master of great magic. Mist, the stoic leader and tactical genius. Malastar, the magical craftsman. Rebellious, powerful, and reckless perfectly sum up Xaxos. These mages are your heroes and tomorrow, after your ordeal, you will join their ranks.

“Each of you must overcome your ordeal to learn discipline and focus, the tools you will need to defend Gravehold. We are nothing without Gravehold. To be a breach mage is to sacrifice your life for Gravehold. When you die, it will be in defense of our city. Once you understand this universal truth...only then will you be ready to become a breach mage.”

Aeon's End is not required to play Aeon's End: Legacy.

What lies beneath the crumbling walls of Karak castle? A labyrinth full of treasures...and monsters! Six brave adventurers are going in there for a fortune waiting to be claimed, each one of them with a different trick up their sleeve — but the treasure chests are locked and monsters are everywhere. Who will outsmart their opponents, beat the monsters, and seize the dragon's gem?

In Karak, a.k.a. Catacombs of Karak, each player leads one of six different characters into the labyrinth. Tile by tile, they uncover what the labyrinth looks like, and it will differ on each playthrough. They have to equip themselves with weapons and spells, fight monsters, and (most importantly) collect treasure. The player with the most treasure at the end of the game wins — a true champion of Karak!

—description from the publisher

As a sport, these kangaroos like to rocket in the air, change sides, and impersonate trampolines or punching balls. Be the best coach for your team in Kang and make them score for victory! This is a kangaroo game that's not for roo-kies!

—description from the publisher

It's harvest time on the carrot farm! In Happy Bunny, all players must work together to help the bunny pick the best carrots to bring home to his family, plucking them from the box just like you would from the ground. Select them carefully because all the bitten carrots are for the bunny, while the hardworking farmer keeps the untouched ones for himself. Compare their harvests at the end of the game to see who picked the tastiest bunch!

—description from the publisher

"But, but...who did that?!"

In the card game Who Did It?, players race to get rid of their cards so that they can avoid the blame of owning the animal that pooped. Each game is as fun as it is fast; quickly find your card, be the first to throw it down, then blame someone else! Was it YOUR cat that pooped in the living room? Because it sure wasn't my bunny!

—description from the publisher

Top Deer is a race game in which 2-4 players try and breed and race the best reindeer for Santa's sleigh team.

The chief stablemaster at Santa's North Pole lair has announced his upcoming retirement, and Santa is holding a contest to decide who to promote. Whoever can win the most races - or most-accurately pick the fastest reindeer most consistently - will get the top job, but there are a number of less-than-nice-list tactics your opponents might employ to bump your career off the track!

Each reindeer is represented by a hand of five regular French-deck playing cards. In each race player stack these cards in a pre-determined order and turn them over to move their reindeer around the track; after each race players have a chance to selectively breed the best traits from their current reindeer into the next generation of racers.

Top Deer is a single-sheet game that doesn't need any construction and just requires a few tokens per player and a couple of decks of cards, intended to be included in a Christmas card.

—description from the publisher

10193 AG – The drug spice melange is the most precious substance in the known universe, enabling humans to achieve great mental feats. It can only be found on the planet Arrakis, commonly referred to as Dune, its profitable harvesting operations administered by the Great House Atreides.

After a treacherous sneak attack by the Padishah Emperor and House Harkonnen, the young Paul Atreides finds refuge with the indigenous Fremen who believe him to be their “Giver of Water”, a messianic off-world prophet destined to lead them out of darkness. The new Duke forms a massive army of Fremen fighters with the aim of fulfilling the prophecy, changing the course of humanity forever.

"DUNE: Struggle for Arrakis" is a two-player Strategic wargame depicting the insurgency known as the Arrakis Revolt. The game builds upon Mark Simonitch's The U.S. Civil War (GMT), adding new twists like changeable terrain, heavy storms and sandworms – all with a simplified ruleset and a more manageable playtime. The game is non-profit and free to download and play.

—description from the designer

Itty Bitty Dungeon Delve is an 18 card tableau manipulation for 2 players. Each player represents a new adventurer exploring the cavernous rooms of a dungeon. Each is looking to gain experience and reach level 5 first, and they do so by rearranging the cards representing each individual cavern in the dungeon.

Players reveal cards from their cavern to rearrange facedown cards or gain knowledge of what the cards may be. At the end of the round they gain experience equal points from their cavern. If a player ends the turn with "The Smiter" card, they may instead choose another cavern to explore.

The first player to reach Level 5 wins!

—description from the designer

It turns out that competition for flowers and the pollen that they produce has become fierce. Regular bees can't tack it. Killer bees can'd do it either. Who can? Ninja bees!

Your Ninja Bee starts in a Hive and has to wage a stealthy path through charted territory to a flower and back safely to the Hive. But beware, for other bees are looking for the same flowers and are not above sabotaging your mission - in fact they relish the chance.

Ninja Bees is a competitive card game for two or three players.
It is mentally challenging (meaning it will hurt your head).
It may ruin all of your friendships.
Includes 46 cards play cards and 2 instruction cards, all 3.25" x 3.75" hexagonal and in a beautiful box.

—description from the designer

La bataille de Fleurus (8 messidor an II) deals with the battle fought on 26th June 1794 between a french army under the command of Jean-Baptiste Jourdan and a Coalition army (Austrians, Dutch, Hanovrians and even a legion of french émigrés, that is royalists) under the command of Prince of Coburg.

La bataille de Fleurus is the 3rd battle of the series Les Soldats de la République.

The game includes an A2 map, a color player aid and 216 counters and markers.

Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).

—description from the designer

This is a light weight racing game for the light hearted. Racing around the track trying to get first over the finishing line as you are pumping up the steam in your engine and knocking out the others out of the way. But be aware that you will lose if you run out of fuel.

A kids and family racing game introducing resource management for younger players. Fuel the car engine to move, the more you feed the engine the faster it could go, but as hotter it gets.

Manage your resources and roll to move.

Bild your own racing tracks with the modular boards, customise your vehicles, manage the resources, nock the other cars out of track or try to break them and win the game.

Slogan: Racing for glory, win with luck and planing.

Theme: Car race

How to win: First to move over the finishing line of the final lap is the winner of the game.

We Are The Word is a cooperative game in which one player tries to guess a word with the help of the other players, each giving him a one-word clue. But if two players come up with the same clue, they can't reveal it.

BuzzPutt is a 1-4 player golf game that has you playing adorable bees! There are three pre-made putt putt courses that you and your friends can play on. Each person will select a bee and its matching ball. You have to place the ball on the starting point of the board, with the arrow pointing towards where you want to move.

Then, you roll the dice and pick a shot (basically a stroke in golf) based on what you have rolled. You can now move your ball that far. If you land on certain tiles, such as the honeycomb tiles, it'll cost you more movement points to move out. If you end up out of bounds, you must end your turn and start your next turn on the last tile you touched. Once everyone is at the end, you can move onto the next course.

—description from the designer

House Rules is a print and play party game where you make the rules!Take turns racing around the board, drawing cards with rules on them and collecting Star Tokens. One turn you might get a Board Rule that advances you three spaces. On your next you might get a Player Rule telling you to:


        Win a 10 second round of Charades or return to your last space
        Tweet to your secret crush or lose a Star Token
        Sketch a player in under 30 seconds AND get their approval
        Break into teams of two, have one player pick a secret word and get the other to answer it - the first team to guess their word wins Star Tokens


Everything you need to play is included in the download. Just print and play!

—description from the designer

Friends gather to grill and eat massive quantities of meat at a backyard barbecue, but there’s not enough space on the grill!

This card game features simultaneous action, variable player powers, hand-management, take-that and a towel to avoid the dreaded Meat Sweats.

The first player to eat 7 pieces of meat ends the game, but the player that consumed the highest combination of quantity and quality meat wins (most points).

Each round, grill cards are spread out in the center of the table to represent meat on the grill. These cards also have a hidden value on the back of the card based on the quality of the meat (for end game scoring).

Players simultaneously position their characters next to a grill card that they will attempt to eat.  Players then simultaneously play a meat craving card (face down) from their hand and reveal.  If players have a matching meat they can score it, unless someone else wants the same meat and is willing to pay more matching cards for it. No one scores ties, unless you or a temporary ally play a Meat Sweats card on your opponent. If you receive the meat sweats card, you're unable to claim meat this round, but you get to keep the meat sweats card, making you more powerful later on!

—description from the publisher

British vs Pirates Volume 2 is a standalone expansion to the successfully Kickstartered game, British vs Pirates. This new game features 2 new factions "French/Buccaneers", new game modes, new miniatures and a lot more. Looking for a ship combat game set during the Golden Age of Piracy? Look no further, British vs Pirates.

—description from the designer

Pocket Skirmish is a fast-paced tactical card game for 2 players, in which you assume control over 3 units on a randomly generated map. With tactics and luck, you achieve victory by defeating all of your opponent's units!

—description from the publisher

The players have to drive their racing cars from start to finish. Movement is determined by a standard die (1-6) and a color die. The result of the color die decides which car is to be moved. So each player rolls for all players in the game. On illustrated spaces, events hinder or benefit the player. The first player to reach space 76 wins the game.

—user summary

Building a Better Monster pits players against each other as Mad Scientists competing to be the first to build a unique creature and bring it to life. When not acting as the Mad Scientist, you take on the role of Angry Villagers trying to work together to stop the current Mad Scientist's work.

The game plays using one standard 6-sided die to determine what twisted blueprints they’ve jotted down from fever-dreams and insane visions, as well as 6 custom Mad Scientist dice to determine what building blocks they’ve managed to collect from local cemeteries, mortuaries, hospitals, or prisons. Each scientist uses these materials to make their twisted schematics a reality. With the help of their faithful lab assistants and the occasional pack of ghouls at their summons, the madness is contagious. The Angry Villagers have their own set of 6 custom dice to determine their actions for the night. Will they storm the lab with a Pitchfork or Fire? Will they decide to cut off the Electricity instead? Maybe some will sleep through the night or decide to go Grave Robbing instead to use for their own creations.

—description from the publisher

Kagami is a one to four player solo or cooperative abstract game in which players attempt to mirror two sides of an eight by eight board or four quadrants for a more challenging experience and more players. The game is played without verbal communication. Players score based on the type and number of stones perfectly matched on the board.

Monster Pit features tableau building, dice drafting, and hand management in a fully co-operative, fantasy adventure game. During the game, loyal Captains must rally their forces to defend the Citadel against the emerging threat of a creature from the deep. Think Gandalf rallying the forces of Minas Tirith in Return of the King.

This is not a tower defense game, but blends several mechanisms including dice drafting (there are custom dice and rolls can be mitigated), tableau building (the player boards are extra large to organize the various cards), and worker placement (in terms of the various buildings your Captain will visit).

Your Captain’s tableau will include soldiers, wizards, heroes, mounts, and wyverns. Some of these characters are for offensive purposes (attacking the Monster etc) and some for defensive purposes (building your resources including your dice pool). During the game player will also complete quests for the King, buy items from the Town Hall, ride a Mount, fight creatures in the streets of the Citadel, upgrade their Captain at the Armoury, visit the Dwarven Grotto for gold, and find helpful trinkets in the Fountain.

The game supports "true solo" (a solo player need only control one Captain), fully co-op multiplayer against the Monster, one vs one (one player controls the Captain, the other player controls the Monster), or one player (controlling the Monster) vs up to four Captains. All play modes feature long or short variants.

There are five monsters included in the game (Dragon, Enchantress, Behemoth, Vampire Queen, and Orc War Chief) both featuring "A" and "B" sides for greater challenge and variation. The game engine can be further adjusted with Difficulty Tokens.

—description from the publisher

Young Jacob Marley is a game of Victorian moneylending. You and your fellow clerks are newly enlisted in the service of the famous Jacob Marley. Your task is to earn the maximum profit by lending Marley's money to the citizens and businesses of London. You hope that by doing so, you might catch young Marley's eye and earn his undying friendship. You have a feeling this might come in handy one day...

Young Jacob Marley is a significant retooling of the classic game Jacob Marley, Esquire, which is also a game of cutthroat money lending in Victorian London. Imagine that.

Lost My Mummy is a two player, set collection game. You are racing your opponent to find your mummies by collecting information about them. This could be the canopic jar, the embalming material, the amulet, or even a death wish. This information is depicted on the cards and these are what you collect over the course of the game.

However, the main dynamic of the game are the dice. These are all bespoke dice that slow up an opponent or speed you up in your race to collect the cards that you need. They have low, medium or high numbers on them and this determines the range of choice that you have to select cards on your turn. Once found, you can then collect the reward for your found Mummy. The player with the most reward money, wins!

This family-friendly game plays at a number of levels, from simple enjoyable gameplay to more complex strategies to win! Over time, players develop a better understanding about how to find their mummies in the quickest time.

The artwork is very detailed and allows for children to really explore the area of Egyptian mummification. They are actively learning about a period of history, without actually realising the information is going in! This is the power of this little card game.

—description from the publisher

As a Roman Trader, it's your job to ensure you have the best and most prestigious collection of goods available for purchase...

Roman Trader is a straight set-collecting card game with a couple of novel twists, not least of which is the fact that the goods you're trying to collect are 'open' to other players — they may know what goods you appear to be collecting, but they won't know if you're putting together a specialist collection of varied goods from a particular country/principality!

The ability to collect from the discard pile and effectively set the game going backwards is another twist, and there's also a selection of special cards available to buy that allow you to increase your Warehouse space (hand-size), Plunder goods from other players, Smuggle goods long thought lost into your warehouse, Increase your Market share of selected goods, or Invest in the collections of other players!

A children's deduction game in the Mastermind tradition.  The goal is to correctly guess the colour and type of three hidden fruits.  A player's guesses are limited by a hangman-like monkey puzzle.  Less accurate guesses use up more turns.

Clock Solitaire is a card game with a traditional deck of 52 cards. The game is called Clock Solitaire, because twelve piles of cards are arranged like a clock face around a 13th one in he middle. The object of the game is to complete all other four-of-a-kind before the four kings are completed.

The cards are dealt face down into 13 piles, twelve in a circle around the last one in the middle. The piles are numbered 1 to 12 as on a clock face with pile 13 in the middle.

The top card of the 13 pile is revealed. Play the card under the corresponding pile. Ace under the 1 pile, 2 under 2, and so on. Faces are played Jacks under 11, Queens under 12, and King under 13. Then reveal the top card of this pile and play it as described above. If there is no more the face down card on this pile continue with the next face down card in clockwise order.

The game is won, if all piles become face up piles of four-of-a-kind. The game is lost, if the fourth king is revealed before all other cards are played face up.

English:
In November 1443, George Kastrioti Skanderbeg, at the head of 300 warriors, abandons the Ottoman army during the Battle of Niš. This is the beginning of an epic quarter-century struggle for freedom, where the principalities of Albania become the shield of the old continent against the incursions of the Ottoman Empire.

Be a part of this historical, strategic board game. Relive this age whose greatness has echoed through the centuries. The age of Skanderbeg!

The focus of this board game is precisely this period in history, filled with the struggles of the empires, kingdoms, and principalities of that time to politically survive and thrive.

Command the economic and military forces of a country. Display your skills as a brilliant strategist by planning moves and conflicts in different territories. Take over castles via diplomacy or strength, which will ensure your victory against your rivals. Change the course of history in just a short time!

We’ve tried to faithfully portray the facts and historical characters of that period without influencing the balance of the game, but have also tried to allow enough freedom for different fun strategies.

It is our hope and aspiration as creators of the game to bring about a friendly atmosphere, because we believe that games serve to bond us with each other.

Shqip (Albanian):
NeÌˆ neÌˆntor teÌˆ vitit 1443, Gjergj Kastrioti SkeÌˆnderbeu neÌˆ krye teÌˆ 300 lufteÌˆtareÌˆve, e leÌˆ ushtrineÌˆ otomane neÌˆ meÌˆshireÌˆ teÌˆ fatit gjateÌˆ betejeÌˆs seÌˆ Nishit. Ky eÌˆshteÌˆ fillimi i njeÌˆ epopeje cÌ§erek shekullore ku principata e arbeÌˆrit i beÌˆhet mburojeÌˆ kontinentit teÌˆ vjeteÌˆr.

BeÌˆhuni pjeseÌˆ e keÌˆsaj loje historiko-strategjike, teÌˆ epokeÌˆs seÌˆ arteÌˆ, madheshtia e seÌˆ cileÌˆs jehoi ndeÌˆr shekuj. EpokeÌˆs seÌˆ SkeÌˆnderbeut!

Fokusi i keÌˆsaj loje strategjike eÌˆshteÌˆ pikeÌˆrisht kjo periudheÌˆ e historiseÌˆ, e mbushur me peÌˆrpjekjet e principateÌˆs seÌˆ arbeÌˆrit, perandoriseÌˆ Otomane, mbreteÌˆriseÌˆ seÌˆ HungariseÌˆ dhe republikeÌˆs seÌˆ Venecias peÌˆr teÌˆ mbijetuar dhe peÌˆrparuar politikisht.

Komando ekonomineÌˆ dhe forcat ushtarake teÌˆ njeÌˆ vendi. Shpalos vlerat e tua si njeÌˆ strateg i shkeÌˆlqyer duke planifikuar leÌˆvizjet dhe konfliktet neÌˆ territore teÌˆ ndryshme.

ZoteÌˆro me diplomaci ose me forceÌˆ keÌˆshtjella, qeÌˆ do teÌˆ sigurojneÌˆ fitoren kundeÌˆr rivaleÌˆve. Ndrysho kursin e historiseÌˆ neÌˆ njeÌˆ koheÌˆ teÌˆ shkurteÌˆr!

Card game in which you should avoid death. A fun, fast and original game!

We prepare the deck of cards in such a way that there are "death" cards. A player must avoid accumulating deaths throughout the game using tricks and strategies to the opposing player. The player who accumulates fewer deaths wins.
